\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\},numbers=left,firstnumber=1,stepnumber=1]
\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{Stack}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{]}
        
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{pop}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{isEmpty}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{raise} \PYG{n+ne}{RuntimeError}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Attempt to pop an empty stack}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
        
        \PYG{n}{topIdx} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}
        \PYG{n}{item} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{topIdx}\PYG{p}{]}
        \PYG{k}{del} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{topIdx}\PYG{p}{]}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{item}
    
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{push}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{append}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{)}
        
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{top}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{isEmpty}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{raise} \PYG{n+ne}{RuntimeError}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Attempt to get top of empty stack}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
        
        \PYG{n}{topIdx} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{topIdx}\PYG{p}{]}
    
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{isEmpty}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{clear}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{]}
    
\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{main}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{s} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Stack}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{items} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{list}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{range}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{items2} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{]}
    
    \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{k} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{push}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{k}\PYG{p}{)}
        
    \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{top}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+m+mi}{9}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 1 Passed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 1 Failed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
        
    \PYG{k}{while} \PYG{o+ow}{not} \PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{isEmpty}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{items2}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{append}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{pop}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{n}{items2}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{reverse}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
    
    \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{items2} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 2 Failed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 2 Passed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
        
    \PYG{k}{try}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{pop}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 3 Failed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
        
    \PYG{k}{except} \PYG{n+ne}{RuntimeError}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 3 Passed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{k}{except}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 3 Failed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{k}{try}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{top}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 4 Failed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
        
    \PYG{k}{except} \PYG{n+ne}{RuntimeError}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 4 Passed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{k}{except}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 4 Failed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}   
        
\PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nv+vm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}name\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{o}{==}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}main\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}

\section{The Queue Datatype}
\label{\detokenize{chap4/chap4:the-queue-datatype}}\label{\detokenize{chap4/chap4:queuecode}}
You can \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} the code for the queue datatype by clicking here.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\},numbers=left,firstnumber=1,stepnumber=1]
\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{Queue}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{]}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{frontIdx} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}
        
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}compress}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{newitems} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{]}
        \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{i} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb}{range}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{frontIdx}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{newitems}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{append}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}
            
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{newitems}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{frontIdx} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}
        
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{dequeue}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{isEmpty}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{raise} \PYG{n+ne}{RuntimeError}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Attempt to dequeue an empty queue}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
        
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} When queue is half full, compress it. This }
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} achieves an amortized complexity of O(1) while}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} not letting the list continue to grow unchecked. }
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{frontIdx} \PYG{o}{*} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2} \PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}compress}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
            
        \PYG{n}{item} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{frontIdx}\PYG{p}{]}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{frontIdx} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{item}
    
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{enqueue}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{append}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{)}
        
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{front}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{isEmpty}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{raise} \PYG{n+ne}{RuntimeError}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Attempt to access front of empty queue}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
        
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{frontIdx}\PYG{p}{]}
        
    
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{isEmpty}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{frontIdx} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{clear}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{]}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{frontIdx} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}
    
\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{main}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{q} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Queue}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{items} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{list}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{range}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{items2} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{]}
    
    \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{k} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{q}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{enqueue}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{k}\PYG{p}{)}
        
    \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{q}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{front}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 1 Passed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 1 Failed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
        
    \PYG{k}{while} \PYG{o+ow}{not} \PYG{n}{q}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{isEmpty}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{items2}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{append}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{q}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{dequeue}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
    
    \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{items2} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 2 Failed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 2 Passed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{k} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{q}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{enqueue}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{k}\PYG{p}{)}   
      
    \PYG{n}{items2} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{]}
    
    \PYG{k}{while} \PYG{o+ow}{not} \PYG{n}{q}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{isEmpty}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{items2}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{append}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{q}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{dequeue}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}  
        
    \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{items2} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 3 Failed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 3 Passed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    
    \PYG{k}{try}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{q}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{dequeue}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 4 Failed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
        
    \PYG{k}{except} \PYG{n+ne}{RuntimeError}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 4 Passed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{k}{except}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 4 Failed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{k}{try}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{q}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{front}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 5 Failed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
        
    \PYG{k}{except} \PYG{n+ne}{RuntimeError}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 5 Passed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{k}{except}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Test 5 Failed}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}  
        
\PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nv+vm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}name\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{o}{==}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}main\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{main}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

\chapter{Sets and Maps}
\label{\detokenize{chap5/chap5:sets-and-maps}}\label{\detokenize{chap5/chap5:setsmaps}}\label{\detokenize{chap5/chap5::doc}}
In the last chapter we studied sequences which are used to keep track of lists of things where duplicate values are allowed. For instance, there can be two sixes in a sequence or list of integers. In this chapter we look at \sphinxstyleemphasis{sets} where duplicate values are not allowed. After examining sets we’ll move on to talk about \sphinxstyleemphasis{maps}. \sphinxstyleemphasis{Maps} may also be called \sphinxstyleemphasis{dictionaries} or \sphinxstyleemphasis{hash tables}.

The term \sphinxstyleemphasis{hash table} actually suggests an implementation of a set or map. The primary focus of this chapter is in understanding \sphinxstyleemphasis{hashing}. Hashing is a very important concept in Computer Science because it is a very efficient method of searching for a value. To begin the chapter we’ll motivate our interest in hashing, then we’ll develop a hashing algorithm for finding values in a set. We’ll also apply hashing to the building of sets and maps. Then we’ll look at an important technique that uses hashing called \sphinxstyleemphasis{memoization} and we’ll apply that technique to a couple of problems.


\section{The HashSet Datatype}
\label{\detokenize{chap5/chap5:the-hashset-datatype}}
You can \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} HashSet datatype implementation here. The implementation is partial. The remainder of the set implementation is left as an exercise for the reader.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\},numbers=left,firstnumber=1,stepnumber=1]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} HashSet.py \PYGZhy{} A hashtable implementation of a set datatype. }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}\PYGZsh{}}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} To complete this implementation you must complete the code for all methods that }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} currently have a \PYGZdq{}pass\PYGZdq{} in them. Consult the documentation for these methods}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} to see what they should return. Many of these methods can be implemented}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} by calling other supporting methods, so make sure you don\PYGZsq{}t write more }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} code than necessary. Many methods take exactly one line of code to implement.}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} The test main function at the bottom should completely run passing all tests}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} once you have implemented the methods here. The test main function is not}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} intended to completely test the entire class though. You have to write}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} additional tests to throroughly test the HashSet class. }

\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{HashSet}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}Placeholder}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{pass}
        
        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}eq\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{other}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{k+kc}{False}
        
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}add}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{idx} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{hash}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZpc{}} \PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n}{loc} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}
        
        \PYG{k}{while} \PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{idx}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{idx}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} item already in set}
                \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{k+kc}{False}
            
            \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{loc} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0} \PYG{o+ow}{and} \PYG{n+nb}{type}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{idx}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{n}{HashSet}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}Placeholder}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{n}{loc} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{idx}
                
            \PYG{n}{idx} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{idx} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZpc{}} \PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{)}
            
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{loc} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{loc} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{idx}
            
        \PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{loc}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{item}  
        
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{k+kc}{True}
    
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}remove}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{idx} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{hash}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZpc{}} \PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{)}
        
        \PYG{k}{while} \PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{idx}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{idx}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{n}{nextIdx} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{idx} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZpc{}} \PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{)}
                \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{nextIdx}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
                    \PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{idx}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}
                \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
                    \PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{idx}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{HashSet}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}Placeholder}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
                \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{k+kc}{True}
            
            \PYG{n}{idx} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{idx} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZpc{}} \PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{items}\PYG{p}{)}
            
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{k+kc}{False}
        
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}rehash}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{oldList}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{newList}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{x} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{oldList}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{x} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None} \PYG{o+ow}{and} \PYG{n+nb}{type}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{x}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{n}{HashSet}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}Placeholder}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{n}{HashSet}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}add}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{x}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{newList}\PYG{p}{)}
                
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{newList}
    
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{contents}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{*} \PYG{l+m+mi}{10}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{numItems} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}
        
        \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{item} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{contents}\PYG{p}{:}

\section{The HashMap Datatype}
\label{\detokenize{chap5/chap5:the-hashmap-datatype}}
You can \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} HashMap datatype implementation here. The implementation is partial. The remainder of the set implementation is left as an exercise for the reader. The HashMap datatype requires a module called hashset.py containing the HashSet datatype.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\},numbers=left,firstnumber=1,stepnumber=1]
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{hashset}

\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{HashMap}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}KVPair}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{key}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{value}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{key} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{key}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{value} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{value}
            
        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}eq\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{other}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb}{type}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{n+nb}{type}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{other}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{k+kc}{False}
            
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{key} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{n}{other}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{key}
        
        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{getKey}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{key}

        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{hSet} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{hashset}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{HashSet}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}contains\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{get}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{key}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{default}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{HashMap}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}KVPair}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{key}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{hSet}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{hSet}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{HashMap}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}KVPair}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{key}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{getValue}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{default}
        
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}delitem\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{key}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{HashMap}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}KVPair}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{key}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{hSet}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{hSet}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{remove}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{key}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{raise} \PYG{n+ne}{KeyError}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Key }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n}{key} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{ not in HashMap}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
        
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{items}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{result} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{]}
        \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{x} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{hSet}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{result}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{append}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{x}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{getKey}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{x}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{getValue}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{result}
    
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{keys}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{result} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{]}
        \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{x} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{hSet}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{result}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{append}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{x}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{getKey}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{result}    
    
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{values}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{result} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{]}
        \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{x} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{hSet}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{result}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{append}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{x}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{getValue}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{result}   
    
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{pop}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{key}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

            \PYG{n}{item} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{hSet}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{key}\PYG{p}{]}   
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{item}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{getValue}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

            \PYG{k}{raise} \PYG{n+ne}{KeyError}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Key }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n}{key} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{ not in HashMap}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

            \PYG{k}{yield} \PYG{n}{x}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{getKey}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{n}{d} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{HashMap}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{d}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}

\chapter{Trees}
\label{\detokenize{chap6/chap6:trees}}\label{\detokenize{chap6/chap6:chap6}}\label{\detokenize{chap6/chap6::doc}}
When we see a tree in our everyday lives the roots are generally in the ground and the leaves are up in the air. The branches of a tree spread out from the roots in a more or less organized fashion. The word \sphinxstyleemphasis{tree} is used in Computer Science when talking about a way data may be organized. Trees have some similarilties to the linked list organization found in {\hyperref[\detokenize{chap4/chap4:chap4}]{\sphinxcrossref{chapter 4}}}. In a tree there are nodes which have links to other nodes. In a linked list each node has one link, to the next node in the list. In a tree each node may have two or more links to other nodes. A tree is not a sequential data structure. It is organized like a tree, except the root is at the top of tree data structures and the leaves are at the bottom. A tree in computer science is usually drawn inverted when compared to the trees we see in nature. There are many uses for trees in computer science.

In this chapter we’ll explore trees and when it makes sense to build and or use a tree in a program. Not every program will need a tree data structure. Nevertheless, trees are used in many types of programs. A knowledge of them is not only a necessity, proper use of them can greatly simplify some types of programs.


\section{Abstract Syntax Trees}
\label{\detokenize{chap6/chap6:abstract-syntax-trees}}
You can \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} prefix expression parser and abstract syntax tree code here. You must have access to the {\hyperref[\detokenize{chap4/chap4:queuecode}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{queue code from chapter 4}}}} to run this program.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\},numbers=left,firstnumber=1,stepnumber=1]
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{queue}

\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{TimesNode}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{left}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{right}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{left}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{right}
        
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{eval}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{eval}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{*} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{eval}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
    
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{inorder}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{inorder}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{ * }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{inorder}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{)}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}} 
    
\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{PlusNode}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{left}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{right}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{left}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{right}
        
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{eval}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{eval}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{eval}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
    
    
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{inorder}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{inorder}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{ + }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{inorder}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{)}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}  
    
\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{NumNode}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{num}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{num} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{num}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{inorder}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{num}\PYG{p}{)}
 
\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{E}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{q}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{q}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{isEmpty}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{raise} \PYG{n+ne}{ValueError}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Invalid Prefix Expression}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    
    \PYG{n}{token} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{q}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{dequeue}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
    
    \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{token} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{+}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{PlusNode}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{E}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{q}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{E}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{q}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
    
    \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{token} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{*}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{TimesNode}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{E}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{q}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{E}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{q}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
    
    \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{NumNode}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{float}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{token}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
    
\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{main}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{x} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{NumNode}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{5}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{y} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{NumNode}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{4}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{p} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{PlusNode}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{x}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{y}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{t} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{TimesNode}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{p}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{NumNode}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{6}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{PlusNode}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{t}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{NumNode}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
    
    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{eval}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{inorder}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
    
    \PYG{n}{x} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{input}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Please enter a prefix expression: }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    
    \PYG{n}{lst} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{x}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{split}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{q} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{queue}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Queue}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
    
    \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{token} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{lst}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{q}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{enqueue}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{token}\PYG{p}{)}
        
    \PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{E}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{q}\PYG{p}{)}
    
    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{eval}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{inorder}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
    
        
    
\PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nv+vm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}name\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}main\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}

\section{Binary Search Trees}
\label{\detokenize{chap6/chap6:binary-search-trees}}
You can \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} binary search tree code here.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\},numbers=left,firstnumber=1,stepnumber=1]
\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{BinarySearchTree}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} This is a Node class that is internal to the BinarySearchTree class. }
    \PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{Node}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{val}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{left}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{right}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{val} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{val}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{left}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{right}
            
        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{getVal}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{val}
        
        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{setVal}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{newval}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{val} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{newval}
            
        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{getLeft}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left}
        
        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{getRight}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right}
        
        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{setLeft}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{newleft}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{newleft}
            
        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{setRight}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{newright}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{newright}
            
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} This method deserves a little explanation. It does an inorder traversal}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} of the nodes of the tree yielding all the values. In this way, we get}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} the values in ascending order.}
        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}iter\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{elem} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left}\PYG{p}{:}
                    \PYG{k}{yield} \PYG{n}{elem}
                    
            \PYG{k}{yield} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{val}
            
            \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{elem} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right}\PYG{p}{:}
                    \PYG{k}{yield} \PYG{n}{elem}

        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}repr\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{BinarySearchTree.Node(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb}{repr}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{val}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb}{repr}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb}{repr}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{)}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}            
            
    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Below are the methods of the BinarySearchTree class. }
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{root}
        
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{val}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{BinarySearchTree}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{val}\PYG{p}{)}
        
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{val}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{BinarySearchTree}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Node}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{val}\PYG{p}{)}
        
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{val} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}} \PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{getVal}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{setLeft}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{BinarySearchTree}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{getLeft}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{val}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{setRight}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{BinarySearchTree}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{getRight}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{val}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
            
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{root}
        
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}iter\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb}{iter}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb}{iter}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}str\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{BinarySearchTree(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb}{repr}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{)}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
 
\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{main}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{s} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{input}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Enter a list of numbers: }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{lst} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{split}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
    
    \PYG{n}{tree} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{BinarySearchTree}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
    
    \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{x} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{lst}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{tree}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{float}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{x}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
        
    \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{x} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{tree}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{x}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nv+vm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}name\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}main\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{main}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

\section{OrderedTreeSet}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\},numbers=left,firstnumber=1,stepnumber=1]

            \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{setVal}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{newval}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

                \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left}
            
            \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{getRight}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right}
            
            \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{setLeft}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{newleft}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{newleft}
                
            \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{setRight}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{newright}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{newright}
                
            \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} This method deserves a little explanation. It does an inorder traversal}
            \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} of the nodes of the tree yielding all the values. In this way, we get}
            \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} the values in ascending order.}
            \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}iter\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
                    \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{elem} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left}\PYG{p}{:}
                        \PYG{k}{yield} \PYG{n}{elem}
                        
                \PYG{k}{yield} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{val}
                
                \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
                    \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{elem} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right}\PYG{p}{:}
                        \PYG{k}{yield} \PYG{n}{elem}

            \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}repr\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{BinarySearchTree.Node(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb}{repr}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{val}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb}{repr}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb}{repr}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{)}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}            
                
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Below are the methods of the BinarySearchTree class. }
        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{root}
            
        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{val}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{OrderedTreeSet}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{BinarySearchTree}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{val}\PYG{p}{)}
            
        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{val}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{OrderedTreeSet}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{BinarySearchTree}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Node}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{val}\PYG{p}{)}
            
            \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{val} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}} \PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{getVal}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{setLeft}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{OrderedTreeSet}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{BinarySearchTree}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{getLeft}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{val}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
            \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{setRight}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{OrderedTreeSet}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{BinarySearchTree}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{getRight}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{val}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
                
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{root}
            
        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}iter\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb}{iter}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{p}{)}
            \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb}{iter}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}

        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}str\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{BinarySearchTree(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb}{repr}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{)}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
            
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{contents}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{tree} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{OrderedTreeSet}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{BinarySearchTree}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{contents} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} randomize the list}
            \PYG{n}{indices} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{list}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{range}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{contents}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
            \PYG{n}{random}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{shuffle}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{indices}\PYG{p}{)}
            
            \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{i} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb}{range}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{contents}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{tree}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{contents}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{indices}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}
                
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{numItems} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{contents}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{numItems} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}
            
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}str\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

    \PYG{n}{lst} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{split}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{n}{main}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

\section{OrderedTreeSet Test Program}
\label{\detokenize{chap6/chap6:orderedtreeset-test-program}}
Here is an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{OrderedTreeSet Test Program}} that provides some tests for the OrderedTreeSet implementation. Your ordered tree set must be saved in a file called orderedtreeset.py so it can be imported into this test program.
\begin{quote}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\},numbers=left,firstnumber=1,stepnumber=1]
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{orderedtreeset}

\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{main}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{s} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{orderedtreeset}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{OrderedTreeSet}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{list}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{range}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{100}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
    
    \PYG{n}{t} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{orderedtreeset}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{OrderedTreeSet}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{list}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{range}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+m+mi}{20}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
    
    \PYG{n}{u} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{orderedtreeset}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{OrderedTreeSet}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{list}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{range}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+m+mi}{20}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}

\end{quote}

\chapter{Graphs}
\label{\detokenize{chap7/chap7:graphs}}\label{\detokenize{chap7/chap7:graphchap}}\label{\detokenize{chap7/chap7::doc}}
Many problems in Computer Science and Mathematics can be reduced to a set of states and a set of transitions between these states. A graph is a mathematical representation of problems like these. In the last chapter we saw that trees serve a variety of purposes in Computer Science. Trees are graphs. However, graphs are more general than trees. Abstracting away the details of a problem and studying it in its simplest form often leads to new insight. As a result, many algorithms have come out of the research in graph theory. Graph theory was first studied by mathematicians. Many of the algorithms in graph theory are named for the mathematician that developed or discovered them. Dijkstra and Kruskal are two such mathematicians and this chapter covers algorithms developed by them.

Representing a graph can be done one of several different ways. The correct way to represent a graph depends on the algorithm being implemented. Graph theory problems include graph coloring, finding a path between two states or nodes in a graph, or finding a shortest path through a graph among many others. There are many algorithms that have come from the study of graphs. To understand the formulation of these problems it is good to learn a little graph notation which is presented in this chapter as well.


\section{Drawing Graphs}
\label{\detokenize{chap7/chap7:drawing-graphs}}
This chapter contains several graph algorithms. Visualizing these graphs can be a challenge. Some of the pictures in the text were drawn from XML formatted files. The XML format was described in the chapter. Here are a few examples of these graph XML files.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{graph.xml}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{directedgraph.xml}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{neiowagraph.xml}}

\end{itemize}

These graphs can be drawn using turtle graphis. You can \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} the drawgraph.py program to draw graphs in this XML format.

There is also a very nice drawing program for Mac OS X called OmniGraffle. Most of the figures in the text were drawn with OmniGraffle. OmniGraffle saves its graphs in XML format as well. We have written a program to convert an OmniGraffle drawing of a graph to the XML format supported by the drawgraph.py program. You can \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} the graphreader.py program here. These programs are available \sphinxstyleemphasis{As\sphinxhyphen{}Is} for educational use. No support is provided for using them. The graphreader.py program happens to be a nice example of using dictionaries in a program.

\chapter{Membership Structures}
\label{\detokenize{chap11/chap11:membership-structures}}\label{\detokenize{chap11/chap11:chap11}}\label{\detokenize{chap11/chap11::doc}}
In {\hyperref[\detokenize{chap5/chap5:setsmaps}]{\sphinxcrossref{chapter 5}}} we studied data structures that support insertion, deletion, membership testing, and iteration. For some applications testing membership may be enough. Iteration and deletion may not be necessary. The classic example is that of a spell checker. Consider the job of a spell checker. A simple one may detect errors in spelling while a more advanced spell checker may suggest alternatives of \sphinxstyleemphasis{correctly} spelled words.

Clearly a spell checker is provided with a large dictionary of words. Using the list of words the spell checker determines whether a word you have is in the dictionary and therefore a correct word. If the word does not appear in the dictionary the word processor or editor may underline the word indicating it may be incorrectly spelled. In some cases the word processor may suggest an alternative, correctly spelled word. In some cases, the word processor may simply correct the mispelling. How do these spell checkers/correctors work? What kind of data structures do they use?

\label{\detokenize{chap11/chap11:an-english-dictionary}}
You can \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} an English dictionary of words by clicking this link.

\chapter{Heaps}
\label{\detokenize{chap8/chap8:heaps}}\label{\detokenize{chap8/chap8:heapchap}}\label{\detokenize{chap8/chap8::doc}}
The word \sphinxstyleemphasis{heap} is used in a couple of different contexts in Computer Science. A heap sometimes refers to an area of memory used for dynamic (i.e. run\sphinxhyphen{}time) memory allocation. Another meaning, and the topic of this chapter, is a data structure that is conceptually a complete binary tree. Heaps are used in implementing priority queues, the heapsort algorithm, and some graph algorithms. Heaps are somewhat like binary search trees in that they maintain an ordering of the items within the tree. However, a heap does not maintain a complete ordering of its items. This has some implications for how a heap may be used.


\section{Heap Program}
\label{\detokenize{chap8/chap8:heap-program}}
Here you can \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} a starter shell for the heap implementation described in the chapter.
To run this program you must also \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} the person.py file. Place both modules in the same directory. The heap.py program file contains a main function to test your heap implementation.

This heap program can be modified to support a different number of children. For instance, a four child heap is also possible. The file defaults to a three child heap.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\},numbers=left,firstnumber=1,stepnumber=1]

\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{  File:  heap.py}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{  Author: }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{  Date:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{  Description:  This module provides the class Heap.  We can create heaps which}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{     are either largest\PYGZhy{}on\PYGZhy{}top or smallest\PYGZhy{}on\PYGZhy{}top.  We can also create heaps }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{     with a maximum number of children of our choice.  As written, the default}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{     number of children is 3 and the default initial capacity is 5.  These}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{     parameters can be changed by the way we invoke the class constructor.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{     }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{     The module also provides the efficient heap sort method.  By default, the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{     methods sorts objects in increasing order.  But we can also sort objects}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{     in decreasing order.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{     }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{     Our implementation works for objects of any class that understand the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{     relational operators.}

  \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}  This method will answer a list of the elements of aSequence, which}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{  understand the relational operators.  It also allows us to create}

          \PYG{n}{largestOnTop} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{True}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{numberOfChildren} \PYG{o}{=}
              \PYG{n}{DefaultNumberOfChildren}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{size} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}

    \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{It is a }\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n}{sortOfHeap} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{ heap:}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}

  \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{addToHeap}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{newObject}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}If the heap is full, double its current capacity.}

  \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{bestChildOf}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{lastIndex}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Answer the index of the \PYGZdq{}best child\PYGZdq{} of self.data[index], if it}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      exists. If not, answer None.  lastIndex is the index of the last }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      object in the heap.  For a largest on top heap, the best child is the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      largest child.  For a smallest on top heap, it is the smallest child}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      of the node with the given index.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
    \PYG{n}{bestChild} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}
    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}  .......}
    \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{bestChild}
            
  \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{buildFrom}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{aSequence}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{        understands the comparison operators. The elements of}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        aSequence are copied into the heap and ordered to build}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        a heap. \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
    \PYG{k}{pass}

  \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{removeTop}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}  If the heap is not empty, remove the top element}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{      removed.  If the heap is empty, return None.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
    \PYG{k}{pass}

  \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{siftDownFrom}\PYG{p}{(} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{fromIndex} \PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}fromIndex is the index of an element in the heap.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      Pre: data[fromIndex..size\PYGZhy{}1] satisfies the heap condition,}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      except perhaps for the element self.data[fromIndex].}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      Post:  That element is sifted down as far as neccessary to}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      maintain the heap structure for data[fromIndex..size\PYGZhy{}1].}

    \PYG{k}{pass}

  \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}siftUpFrom}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{child}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} child is the index of a node in the heap.  This method sifts}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      that node up as far as necessary to ensure that the path to the root}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      satisfies the heap condition. \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
    \PYG{k}{pass}

  \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}siftDownFromTo}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{fromIndex}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{lastIndex}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}fromIndex is the index of an element in the heap.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{      except perhaps for the element data[fromIndex].}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      Post:  That element is sifted down as far as neccessary to}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      maintain the heap structure for data[fromIndex..lastIndex].\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
    \PYG{k}{pass}
    
  \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{levelByLevelString}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

    \PYG{n}{maxLevel} \PYG{o}{=} \PYGZbs{}
       \PYG{n}{math}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{ceil}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{math}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{log}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{size}\PYG{o}{*}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{numberOfChildren} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{o}{/}
            \PYG{n}{math}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{log}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{numberOfChildren}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}  MORE!              }

  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}  Other methods?}
  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}  Use Doc strings for all methods!}
        
\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{main}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{It is a largest on top heap:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{The size of the heap is 10.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{The capacity of the heap is 20.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{The elements of the heap are: }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{900}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{72}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{99}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{40}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{20}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZhy{}100}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{54}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZhy{}10}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{84}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{trying heapSort method:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{[\PYGZhy{}1000, \PYGZhy{}30, 20, 37, 45, 57, 200, 921, 4000]}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{[4000, 921, 200, 57, 45, 37, 20, \PYGZhy{}30, \PYGZhy{}1000]}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{[Name: David Id: 23 , Name: Joe Id: 99 , Name: Al Id: 110 ,}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{   Name: Al Id: 110 , Name: Joe Id: 99 , Name: David Id: 23 ]}

\chapter{Balanced Binary Search Trees}
\label{\detokenize{chap9/chap9:balanced-binary-search-trees}}\label{\detokenize{chap9/chap9:balancedtreechap}}\label{\detokenize{chap9/chap9::doc}}
In {\hyperref[\detokenize{chap6/chap6:chap6}]{\sphinxcrossref{chapter 6}}} binary search trees were defined along with a recursive insert algorithm. The discussion of binary search trees pointed out they have problems in some cases. Binary search trees can become unbalanced, actually quite often. When a tree is unbalanced the complexity of insert, delete, and lookup operations can get as bad as \(\Theta(n)\). This problem with unbalanced binary search trees was the motivation for the development of height\sphinxhyphen{}balanced AVL trees by G. M. Adelson\sphinxhyphen{}Velskii and E. M. Landis, two Soviet computer scientists, in 1962. AVL trees were named for these two inventors. Their paper on AVL trees {\color{red}\bfseries{}:cite:\textasciigrave{}avltrees\textasciigrave{}} described the first algorithm for maintaining balanced binary search trees. The chapter goes on to discuss Splay Trees as another example of balanced binary search trees.


\section{AVL Tree Implementations}
\label{\detokenize{chap9/chap9:avl-tree-implementations}}
AVL trees maintain their own balance. The balance can be maintained in one of two ways. Either the height of each node in the tree can be maintained or the balance of each node in the tree can be maintained. If maintaining the height, there is a little more work to be done to adjust heights all the way up the tree. If balance is maintained then the code gets a little trickier, but there balances only need to be adjusted up to a pivot node.

In addition, AVL trees can be implemented with recursive or iterative \sphinxstyleemphasis{insert} and \sphinxstyleemphasis{delete} methods. Both are described in the text.


\subsection{Iteratively Implemented AVL Tree}
\label{\detokenize{chap9/chap9:iteratively-implemented-avl-tree}}
You can \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} avltree.py to work on an iterative implementation of AVL Trees.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\},numbers=left,firstnumber=1,stepnumber=1]
\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{  File:  avltree.py}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{  Author: Steve Hubbard,  and}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{  Date:}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{  Description:  This module provides the AVLNode and AVLTree classes.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}

\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{stack} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Stack}

\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{AVLNode}\PYG{p}{:}
   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{balance} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{item} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{item}
      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}
      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}
      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{balance} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{balance}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}str\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}  This performs an inorder traversal of the tree rooted at self,}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{         using recursion.  Return the corresponding string.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{ }\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{balance}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+}  \PYG{n}{st}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} A recursive call: str(self.left)}
      \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right}\PYG{p}{)}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Another recursive call}
      \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{st}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{rotateLeft}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}  Perform a left rotation of the subtree rooted at the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       receiver.  Answer the root node of the new subtree.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{n}{child} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right}
      \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{child} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Error!  No right child in rotateLeft.}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}} \PYG{p}{)}
         \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{k+kc}{None}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} redundant}
      \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{child}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left}
         \PYG{n}{child}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}
         \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{child}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{rotateRight}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}  Perform a right rotation of the subtree rooted at the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       receiver.  Answer the root node of the new subtree.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{n}{child} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left}
      \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{child} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Error!  No left child in rotateRight.}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}} \PYG{p}{)}
         \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{k+kc}{None}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} redundant}
      \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{child}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right}
         \PYG{n}{child}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}
         \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{child}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{rotateRightThenLeft}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}Perform a double inside left rotation at the receiver.  We}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       assume the receiver has a right child (the bad child), which has a left}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       child. We rotate right at the bad child then rotate left at the pivot}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       node, self. Answer the root node of the new subtree.  We call this}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       case 3, subcase 2.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{k}{pass}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{rotateLeftThenRight}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}Perform a double inside right rotation at the receiver.  We}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       assume the receiver has a left child (the bad child) which has a right}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       child. We rotate left at the bad child, then rotate right at}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       the pivot, self.  Answer the root node of the new subtree. We call this}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       case 3, subcase 2.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{k}{pass}

\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{AVLTree}\PYG{p}{:}
   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}
      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{count} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}str\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{There are }\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{count}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{ nodes in the AVL tree.}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{k}{return}  \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{p}{)}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Using the string hook for AVL nodes}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{newItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}  Add a new node with item newItem, if there is not a match in the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        tree.  Perform any rotations necessary to maintain the AVL tree,}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        including any needed updates to the balances of the nodes.  Most of the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        actual work is done by other methods.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{k}{pass}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{adjustBalances}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{theStack}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{pivot}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{newItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}  We adjust the balances of all the nodes in theStack, up to and}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{         including the pivot node, if any.  Later rotations may cause}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{         some of the balances to change.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{k}{pass}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{case1}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{theStack}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{pivot}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{newItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}  There is no pivot node.  Adjust the balances of all the nodes}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{         in theStack.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{adjustBalances}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{theStack}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{pivot}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{newItem}\PYG{p}{)}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{case2}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{theStack}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{pivot}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{newItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} The pivot node exists.  We have inserted a new node into the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{         subtree of the pivot of smaller height.  Hence, we need to adjust}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{         the balances of all the nodes in the stack up to and including}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{         that of the pivot node.  No rotations are needed.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{adjustBalances}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{theStack}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{pivot}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{newItem}\PYG{p}{)}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{case3}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{theStack}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{pivot}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{newItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}  The pivot node exists.  We have inserted a new node into the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{         larger height subtree of the pivot node.  Hence rebalancing and}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{         rotations are needed.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{adjustBalances}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{theStack}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{pivot}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{newItem}\PYG{p}{)}
      \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Lots more!!!!}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{search}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{newItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}  The AVL tree is not empty.  We search for newItem. This method will}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        return a tuple: (pivot, theStack, parent, found).}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        In this tuple, if there is a pivot node, we return a reference to it}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        (or None). We create a stack of nodes along the search path \PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} theStack.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        We indicate whether or not we found an item which matches newItem.  We}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        also return a reference to the last node the search examined \PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} referred}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        to here as the parent.  (Note that if we find an object, the parent is}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        reference to that matching node.)  If there is no match, parent is a}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        reference to the node used to add a child in insert().}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{k}{pass}

\subsection{Recursively Implemented AVL Tree}
\label{\detokenize{chap9/chap9:recursively-implemented-avl-tree}}
AVL trees may also be implemented recursively meaning that the insert and delete methods can be written recursively. The outline of this implementation can be seen in the text. It is relatively short and is not provided for download.


\section{Splay Tree Implementations}
\label{\detokenize{chap9/chap9:splay-tree-implementations}}
Splay trees do not maintain the balance or height. Instead they rely on rotations that always rotate a inserted or accessed element to the root of the tree. In doing this they maintain a balance in the tree, often exploiting spatial locality. Again, splay trees may be implemented recursively or iteratively.


\subsection{Iteratively Implemented Splay Tree}
\label{\detokenize{chap9/chap9:iteratively-implemented-splay-tree}}
You can \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} splaytree.py to work on an iterative implementation of splay trees. To run this program you will need to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} stack.py module and you’ll need to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} person.py module.

\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{ File: splaytree.py}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{ Author(s): Steve Hubbard and }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{ Date: 9/17/13}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{ Description: This module implements the SplayTree class and the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{   SplayNode class.  The classes use bottom up splaying rather than }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{   top down splaying.  We do not allow duplicate objects in the tree.}

\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{SplayNode}\PYG{p}{:}
   \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} This module implements the SplayNode class. This}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{     class in turn is used by the SplayTree class.  The classes}
