   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{left} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{right} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{left}
      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{item} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{item}
      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{right}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}str\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:} 
      \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{*}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} recursion}
      \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{)}
      \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{*}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} recursion}
      \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{)}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{st}
   
   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{inorder}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Perform an inorder traversal of the subtree rooted at}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        the receiver.  Print each item in this subtree during}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        the traversal.  This is done with recursion.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{k}{pass}
      
   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{insertInNode}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{anItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Try to insert a copy of anItem into the bottom up splay}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       tree rooted at the receiver.  If anItem is already in the tree,}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       do not insert an extra copy. In any case, splay the new node,}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       or the last node on the search path, to the root.  The method}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       will answer a tuple.  The first element is True or False}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       according to whether a new element was added or not.  The}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       second element is the new root node.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
       \PYG{k}{pass}
   
   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{rotateLeft}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}  Perform a left rotation of the subtree rooted at the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       receiver.  Answer the root node of the new subtree.  }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{n}{child} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right}
      \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{child} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Error!  No right child in rotateLeft. }\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}} \PYG{p}{)}
         \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{k+kc}{None}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} redundant}
      \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{child}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left}
         \PYG{n}{child}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}
         \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{child}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{splayToRoot}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{stack}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}  Perform a bottom up splay beginning at the node at the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{       top of the stack.  Answer the root of the new tree.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{k}{pass}
      
   \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}  Many more methods! \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      

\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{SplayTree}\PYG{p}{:}
   
   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{size} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}
      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}str\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{p}{)}
      \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
   
   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{delete}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{anItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}  Atempt to find a match (==) for anItem in the receiver.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      If found, splay the corresponding node to the root and answer}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      the item of the node. If not found, splay the last node on}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      the search path to the root. In this case, answer None.  If}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      found, we remove the node and make the largest element of the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      new left subtree (from the splaying of the node to the root}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      position) the new root node of the tree.  Of course finding}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      the largest element uses a splaying on that left subtree.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      If there is no left subtree, the right subtree becomes the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      root.  This may leave us with an empty tree.  If found,}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      decrement the size of the tree and answer the item deleted.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      If not found, answer None.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{k}{pass}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{findMax}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Find the largest element in the splay tree.  Splay that}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      element to the root.  Answer a deep copy of the element.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      If the tree is empty, answer None.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{k}{pass} 

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{findMin}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Find the smallest element in the splay tree.  Splay that}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      element to the root.  Answer a deep copy of the element.  If}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      the tree is empty, answer None.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{k+kc}{None}
      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{findMin}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
      \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{deepcopy}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{getItem}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{getSize}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{size}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{inorder}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Print the contents of the receiver, in inorder.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        Print one item per line.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
      \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{inorder}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{anItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Insert a deep copy of anItem into the bottom up splay tree.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      If anItem is already present in the tree, do not insert a new }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      copy of anItem.  If anItem is added, increment the size of}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      the receiver.  In either case, we splay from}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      the last node.  If anItem was added, answer anItem.  If not,}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      answer None.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{Name: John Id: 30 }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{Name: Jill Id: 35 }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{Name: Jud Id: 95 }

\subsection{Recursively Implemented Splay Tree}
\label{\detokenize{chap9/chap9:recursively-implemented-splay-tree}}
A recursive implementation of splay trees relies on keeping track of the left or right double rotations as the recursive insert or lookup returns up the tree. To accomplish this you must call a rotate function. Calling \sphinxstyleemphasis{rotate{[}“RL”{]}(pivot)} would call the rotate right then left double rotation. The \sphinxstyleemphasis{rotate} variable is a dictionary (i.e. hash table) in the code provided here.

You can \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} splay.py file to begin working on the recursive splay tree implementation.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\},numbers=left,firstnumber=1,stepnumber=1]
\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{ File: splay.py}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{ Author: Kent D. Lee}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{ Date: 8/21/2014}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{ Description: This module implements the SplayTree class. This}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{   class uses the SplayNode class.  The classes}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{   use bottom up splaying rather than top down splaying.  We}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{   do not allow duplicate objects in the tree.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{   Delete is not implemented in this file currently. Test code}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{   should be added to thoroughly test insert, lookup, and delete. }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{   Recall that looking up a value rotates it to the root. Deleting }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{   an item rotates its parent to the root. }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}

\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{rotateLeft}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{pivot}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
   \PYG{k}{pass}

\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{rotateRight}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{pivot}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
   \PYG{k}{pass}

\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{rotateRL}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{pivot}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
   \PYG{k}{pass}

\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{rotateLR}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{pivot}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
   \PYG{k}{pass}

\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{rotateRR}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{pivot}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
   \PYG{k}{pass}

\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{rotateLL}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{pivot}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
   \PYG{k}{pass}

\PYG{n}{rotate} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\PYG{n}{rotate}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{RL}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{rotateRL}
\PYG{n}{rotate}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{LR}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{rotateLR}
\PYG{n}{rotate}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{RR}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{rotateRR}
\PYG{n}{rotate}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{LL}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{rotateLL}

\PYG{n}{singleRotate} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\PYG{n}{singleRotate}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{R}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{rotateRight}
\PYG{n}{singleRotate}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{L}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{rotateLeft}

\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{SplayTree}\PYG{p}{:}

   \PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{SplayNode}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{left}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{right}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{item} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{item}
         \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{left}
         \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{right}
         
      \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}str\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
         \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{*}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
         \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{left}\PYG{p}{)}
         \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{)}
         \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{*}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
         \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{right}\PYG{p}{)}
         \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{)}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
         \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{st}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}
      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{rString} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}


   \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Pass searching = True if just searching and not }
   \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} really inserting. If the item is found, true is }
   \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} returned. If the item is not found, an exception}
   \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} containing false is raised. }

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{searching}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{False}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

      \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} return the new root after inserting}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{             item into the tree currently rooted at }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{             root. If searching for the value and not }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{             inserting, then raise Exception(False) if }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{             the item is not found. }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{         \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}

         \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{root}

      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{found} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{False}

      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{)}

      \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Handle any single rotation that must }
      \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} be done after inserting the value. }
      \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{rString} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{singleRotate}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{singleRotate}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{rString}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{p}{)}

      \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{rString} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}

      \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{found}

   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{lookup}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

      \PYG{k}{try}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{k+kc}{True}\PYG{p}{)}
      \PYG{k}{except} \PYG{n+ne}{Exception} \PYG{k}{as} \PYG{n}{inst}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{inst}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{args}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{k+kc}{False}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{k+kc}{False}

         \PYG{k}{raise} \PYG{n+ne}{Exception}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{inst}\PYG{p}{)}
            
   \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}str\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
      \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{root}\PYG{p}{)}
      \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
         \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}

\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{main}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
   \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} This should print the following.}

   \PYG{n}{t} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{SplayTree2}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

\chapter{B\sphinxhyphen{}Trees}
\label{\detokenize{chap10/chap10:b-trees}}\label{\detokenize{chap10/chap10::doc}}
This chapter covers one of the more important data structures of the last thirty years. B\sphinxhyphen{}Trees are primarily used by relational databases to efficiently implement an operation called \sphinxstyleemphasis{join}. B\sphinxhyphen{}Trees have other properties that are also useful for databases including ordering of rows within a table, fast delete capability, and sequential access. The chapter begins by introducing some terminology from relational databases to motivate the need for B\sphinxhyphen{}Trees. It goes on to introduce the B\sphinxhyphen{}Tree data structure and its implementation. By the end of this chapter you should have an understanding of B\sphinxhyphen{}Trees, their advantages over other data structures, and you should be able to demonstrate your understanding by implementing a B\sphinxhyphen{}Tree that can be used to efficiently process \sphinxstyleemphasis{joins} in relational databases.


\section{Relational Database Tables}
\label{\detokenize{chap10/chap10:relational-database-tables}}
You can find the three database tables from the text here.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Feed.tbl}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{FeedAttribute.tbl}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{FeedAttribType.tbl}}

\end{itemize}


\section{The Inefficient Join Program}
\label{\detokenize{chap10/chap10:the-inefficient-join-program}}
The inefficient join program can be \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{downloaded}} by clicking here.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\},numbers=left,firstnumber=1,stepnumber=1]
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{datetime}

\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{readField}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{record}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{colTypes}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{fieldNum}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} fieldNum is zero based}
    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} record is a string containing the record}
    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} colTypes is the types for each of the columns in the record}
    
    \PYG{n}{offset} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}
    \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{i} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb}{range}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{fieldNum}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{colType} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{colTypes}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{p}{]}
        
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{colType} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{int}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{offset}\PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{10}
        \PYG{k}{elif} \PYG{n}{colType}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{l+m+mi}{4}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{char}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{size} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{int}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{colType}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{4}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}
            \PYG{n}{offset} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{size}
        \PYG{k}{elif} \PYG{n}{colType} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{float}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{offset}\PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{20}

\section{B\sphinxhyphen{}Tree Implementations}
\label{\detokenize{chap10/chap10:b-tree-implementations}}
B\sphinxhyphen{}Trees, like most other tree data structures can be implemented both iteratively and recursively. Both implementations are described in the text and they both have starter shells provided here.

Each implementation includes two main functions. The \sphinxstyleemphasis{btreemain} in each contains a test program. Sample output is included in the file for the \sphinxstyleemphasis{btreemain} function. The other \sphinxstyleemphasis{main} function contains the join query using the B\sphinxhyphen{}Tree implementation to construct a B\sphinxhyphen{}Tree index over two of the database tables to improve the join efficiency. Comparing either of these queries to the inefficient join program above will illustrate the advantage of a B\sphinxhyphen{}Tree over sequential search.


\subsection{Iterative B\sphinxhyphen{}Tree}
\label{\detokenize{chap10/chap10:iterative-b-tree}}
This shell is provided as an implementation that supports an iterative implementation of insert, delete, and update. The starting shell can be \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{downloaded}} here. As stated above, the program contains two main functions for testing of the B\sphinxhyphen{}Tree implementation. The Stack implementation is required for this program and can be \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{downloaded}} here. The Queue implementation is required for this program and can be \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{downloaded}} here. These two files must be placed in the same directory as the database tables and the B\sphinxhyphen{}Tree implementation file.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\},numbers=left,firstnumber=1,stepnumber=1]
\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{  File: btree.py}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{  Author: Steve Hubbard and Kent D. Lee}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{  Date: 8/27/2014}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{  Description: This module provides the BTree class, based on support from}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    the BTreeNode class.  The BTreeNode class is also implemented in this }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    module. This module is meant to support the iterative implementation of }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    insert and lookup within a BTree. }

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    The module requires the Stack and Queue classes from the corresponding}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    two modules, stack.py and queue.py. }

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    This program has two main functions, the btreemain function and the main}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    function. The btreemain function tests the BTree datatype. The expected}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    output is provided in a comment after the function. Once the btreemain }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    function runs and produces the proper output, the main function can be }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    run to test the BTree with the join functionality. }

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    The main function either builds a new BTree or reads an existing BTree }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    from the index files, Feed.idx and FeedAttribType.idx files. If the idx}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    file does not exist, then a new BTree is built and written to the }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    corresponding idx file. }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}

        \PYG{n}{index} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Create an empty node with the indicated degree\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{numberOfKeys} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{numberOfKeys}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{items} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{items}
        \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{o}{*}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{o}{*}\PYG{n}{degree}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{child} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{child} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{child}
        \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{addItemAndSplit}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{anItem}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{left}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{right}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{         If the receiver is not full, generate an error.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{         If full, split the receiver into two nodes, the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{         smallest degree + 1 keys staying in the original node.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{         The largest degree keys go into a new node which is}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{         returned. Note that the last child of the receiver}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{         and the first child of the new node will be the same.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{k}{pass}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{getChild}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Answer the index of the ith child}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{i} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{numberOfKeys}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{child}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{p}{]}
        \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Error in getChild().}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}} \PYG{p}{)}
            
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{setChild}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{i}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{childIndex}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Set the ith child of the node to childIndex}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{child}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{childIndex}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{childIndexOf}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{anIndex}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Answer the index of the child in the receiver}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} which contains anIndex.}
        \PYG{n}{index} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}
        \PYG{n}{k} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}
        \PYG{n}{found} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{False}
        \PYG{k}{while} \PYG{o+ow}{not} \PYG{n}{found} \PYG{o+ow}{and} \PYG{n}{k} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{numberOfKeys} \PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{child}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{k}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{n}{anIndex}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{n}{index} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{k}
                \PYG{n}{found} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{True}
            \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{n}{k} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{index} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Error in childIndexOf}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}} \PYG{p}{)}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}
        \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{index}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{clear}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{copyItemsAndChildren}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{fromNode}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{start}\PYG{p}{,}

        \PYG{k}{pass}
  
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{copyWithRight}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{aNode}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{parentNode}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{insertItem}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{anItem}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{left}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{right}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{removeChild}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} If the index is valid, remove and answer the child at}

        \PYG{k}{pass}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{searchNode}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{anItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}str\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} This method is complete }
        \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{  The degree of the BTree is }\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{degree}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{o}{+}\PYGZbs{}

        \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{  The index of the root node is }\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYGZbs{}
              \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{rootIndex}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{.}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{x} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb}{range}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{freeIndex}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{node} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{readFrom}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{x}\PYG{p}{)}
            \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{node}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{getNumberOfKeys}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{node}\PYG{p}{)} 
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{st}

          
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{delete}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{anItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Answer None if a matching item is not found.  If found,}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          answer the entire item.  }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{k}{pass}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{getFreeIndex}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Answer a new index and update freeIndex.  Private}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{freeIndex} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{freeIndex} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{getFreeNode}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}Answer a new BTreeNode with its index set correctly.}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}Also, update freeIndex.  Private}
        \PYG{n}{newNode} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{BTreeNode}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{degree}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n}{index} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{getFreeIndex}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n}{newNode}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{setIndex}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{writeAt}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{newNode}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{newNode}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{inorderOn}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{aFile}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          Print the items of the BTree in inorder on the file }

        \PYG{n}{aFile}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{write}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{An inorder traversal of the BTree:}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{inorderOnFrom}\PYG{p}{(} \PYG{n}{aFile}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{rootIndex}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{inorderOnFrom}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{aFile}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Print the items of the subtree of the BTree, which is}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{k}{pass}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{anItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Answer None if the BTree already contains a matching}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{levelByLevel}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{aFile}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Print the nodes of the BTree level\PYGZhy{}by\PYGZhy{}level on aFile. )}

        \PYG{k}{pass}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{readFrom}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Answer the node at entry index of the btree structure.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          Later adapt to files}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{nodes}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}contains\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{nodes}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{]}
        \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{k+kc}{None}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{recycle}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{aNode}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} For now, do nothing}
        \PYG{n}{aNode}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{clear}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{retrieve}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{anItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} If found, answer a deep copy of the matching item.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          If not found, answer None}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{k}{pass}  

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}searchTree}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{anItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Answer a dictionary.  If there is a matching item, at}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          \PYGZsq{}found\PYGZsq{} is True, at \PYGZsq{}fileIndex\PYGZsq{} is the index of the node}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          in the BTree with the matching item, and at \PYGZsq{}nodeIndex\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          is the index into the node of the matching item.  If not,}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          at \PYGZsq{}found\PYGZsq{} is False, but the entry for \PYGZsq{}fileIndex\PYGZsq{} is the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          leaf node where the search terminated.  An important}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          function of this method is that it pushes all of the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          nodes of the search path from the rootnode, down to,}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          but not including the corresponding leaf node of a search}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          (or the node containing a match).  Again, the rootnode}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          is pushed if it is not a leaf node and has no match.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{k}{pass}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{update}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{anItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} If found, update the item with a matching key to be a}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          deep copy of anItem and answer anItem.  If not, answer None.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{k}{pass}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{writeAt}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{aNode}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Set the element in the btree with the given index}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          to aNode.  This method must be invoked to make any}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          permanent changes to the btree.  We may later change}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          this method to work with files.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          This method is complete at this time.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{nodes}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{aNode}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Feed.FeedID = FeedAttribute.FeedID and FeedAttribute.FeedAtribTypeID = FeedAttribType.ID}

\subsection{Recursive B\sphinxhyphen{}Tree}
\label{\detokenize{chap10/chap10:recursive-b-tree}}
This shell is provided as an implementation that supports a recursive implementation of insert, delete, and update. The starting shell can be \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{downloaded}} here. As stated above, the program contains two main functions for testing of the B\sphinxhyphen{}Tree implementation. The Queue implementation is required for this program and can be \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{downloaded}} here. This file must be placed in the same directory as the database tables and the B\sphinxhyphen{}Tree implementation file.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\},numbers=left,firstnumber=1,stepnumber=1]
\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{  File: btree.py}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{  Author: Kent D. Lee and Steve Hubbard}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{  Date: 06/30/2014}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{  Description: This module provides the BTree class, based on support from}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    the BTreeNode class.  The BTreeNode class is also implemented in this }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    module. This module is meant to support the recursive implementation of }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    insert, lookup, and delete within a BTree. }

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    The module requires the Queue class in the queue module.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    This program has two main functions, the btreemain function and the main}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    function. The btreemain function tests the BTree datatype. The expected}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    output is provided in a comment after the function. Once the btreemain }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    function runs and produces the proper output, the main function can be }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    run to test the BTree with the join functionality. }

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    The main function either builds a new BTree or reads an existing BTree }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    from the index files, Feed.idx and FeedAttribType.idx files. If the idx}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    file does not exist, then a new BTree is built and written to the }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    corresponding idx file.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{datetime}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{os}
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{copy} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{deepcopy}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{sys}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{queue}

\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{BTreeNode}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      This class will be used by the BTree class.  Much of the functionality of}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{      BTrees is provided by this class.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{degree} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{numberOfKeys} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{items} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{child} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{,} \PYGZbs{}
        \PYG{n}{index} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Create an empty node with the indicated degree\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{numberOfKeys} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{numberOfKeys}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{items} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{items}
        \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{o}{*}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{o}{*}\PYG{n}{degree}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{child} \PYG{o}{!=} \PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{child} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{child}
        \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{bTree}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{item}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{getLeftMost}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{bTree}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{redistributeOrCoalesce}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{bTree}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{childIndex}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          This method is given a node and a childIndex within }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          that node that may need redistribution or coalescing.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          The child needs redistribution or coalescing if the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          number of keys in the child has fallen below the }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          degree of the BTree. If so, then redistribution may}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          be possible if the child is a leaf and a sibling has }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          extra items. If redistribution does not work, then }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          the child must be coalesced with either the left }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          or right sibling.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{          This method does not return anything, but has the }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          side\PYGZhy{}effect of redistributing or coalescing}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          the child node with a sibling if needed. }
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{k}{pass} 


    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{getChild}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{i}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

        \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Error in getChild().}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}} \PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}init\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{degree}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{nodes} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{rootIndex} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{freeIndex} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{degree} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{degree}

            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{nodes} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{rootNode}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{setIndex}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{rootIndex}\PYG{p}{)}

            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{nodes} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{deepcopy}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{nodes}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}str\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{  The degree of the BTree is }\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{degree}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{o}{+}\PYGZbs{}

        \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{  The index of the root node is }\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}} \PYG{o}{+} \PYGZbs{}
              \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{rootIndex}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{+} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{.}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{x} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb}{range}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{freeIndex}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n}{node} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{readFrom}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{x}\PYG{p}{)}
            \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{node}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{getNumberOfKeys}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{n}{st} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{node}\PYG{p}{)} 
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{st}


    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{delete}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{anItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Answer None if a matching item is not found.  If found,}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}} 
        \PYG{k}{pass}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{getFreeIndex}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Answer a new index and update freeIndex.  Private}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{freeIndex} \PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{freeIndex} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{getFreeNode}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}Answer a new BTreeNode with its index set correctly.}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}Also, update freeIndex.  Private}
        \PYG{n}{newNode} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{BTreeNode}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{degree}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n}{index} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{getFreeIndex}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n}{newNode}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{setIndex}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{writeAt}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{newNode}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{newNode}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{inorderOn}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{aFile}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}

        \PYG{n}{aFile}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{write}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{An inorder traversal of the BTree:}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{inorderOnFrom}\PYG{p}{(} \PYG{n}{aFile}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{rootIndex}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{inorderOnFrom}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{aFile}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{insert}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{anItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Answer None if the BTree already contains a matching}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{          anItem.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{k}{pass}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{levelByLevel}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{aFile}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Print the nodes of the BTree level\PYGZhy{}by\PYGZhy{}level on aFile. )}

        \PYG{k}{pass}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{readFrom}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Answer the node at entry index of the btree structure.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          Later adapt to files}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{nodes}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n+nf+fm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}contains\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{nodes}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{]}
        \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{k+kc}{None}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{recycle}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{aNode}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} For now, do nothing}
        \PYG{n}{aNode}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{clear}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{retrieve}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{anItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} If found, answer a deep copy of the matching item.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          If not found, answer None}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{k}{pass}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}searchTree}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{anItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Answer a dictionary.  If there is a matching item, at}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          \PYGZsq{}found\PYGZsq{} is True, at \PYGZsq{}fileIndex\PYGZsq{} is the index of the node}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          in the BTree with the matching item, and at \PYGZsq{}nodeIndex\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          is the index into the node of the matching item.  If not,}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          at \PYGZsq{}found\PYGZsq{} is False, but the entry for \PYGZsq{}fileIndex\PYGZsq{} is the}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          leaf node where the search terminated.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{k}{pass}

 
    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{update}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{anItem}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} If found, update the item with a matching key to be a}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          deep copy of anItem and answer anItem.  If not, answer None.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{k}{pass}

    \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{writeAt}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{aNode}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{} Set the element in the btree with the given index}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          to aNode.  This method must be invoked to make any}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          permanent changes to the btree.  We may later change}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          this method to work with files.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{          This method is complete at this time.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{        \PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{nodes}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{index}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{aNode}

        \PYG{n}{indexFile} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{open}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Feed.idx}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{w}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

\chapter{Heuristic Search}
\label{\detokenize{chap12/chap12:heuristic-search}}\label{\detokenize{chap12/chap12:chap12}}\label{\detokenize{chap12/chap12::doc}}
This text has focused on the interaction of algorithms with data structures. Many of the algorithms presented in this text deal with search and how to organize data so searching can be done efficiently. Many problems involve searching for an answer among many possible solutions, not all of which are correct. Sometimes, there are so many possibilities, no algorithm can be written that will efficiently find a correct solution amongst all the possible solutions. In these cases, we may be able to use a \sphinxstyleemphasis{rule of thumb}, most often called a \sphinxstyleemphasis{heuristic} in computer science, to eliminate some of these possibilities from our search space. If the \sphinxstyleemphasis{heuristic} does not eliminate possible solutions, it may at least help us order the possible solutions so we look at \sphinxstyleemphasis{better} possible solutions first, whatever \sphinxstyleemphasis{better} might mean.

In {\hyperref[\detokenize{chap7/chap7:graphchap}]{\sphinxcrossref{chapter 7}}} depth first search of a graph was presented. Sometimes search spaces for graphs or other problems grow to such an enormous size, it is impossible to blindly search for a goal node. This is where a heuristic can come in handy. This chapter uses searching a maze, which is really just a type of graph, as an example to illustrate several search algorithms that are related to depth first or breadth first search. Several applications of these search algorithms are also presented or discussed.

Heuristic search is often covered in texts on Artificial Intelligence {\color{red}\bfseries{}:cite:\textasciigrave{}AIIlluminated\textasciigrave{}}. As problems in AI are better understood, algorithms arise that become more commonplace over time. The heuristic algorithms presented in this chapter are covered in more detail in an AI text, but as data sizes grow, heuristic search will become more and more necessary in all sorts of applications. AI techniques may be useful in many search problems and so are covered in this chapter to provide an introduction to search algorithms designed to deal with large or infinite search spaces.


\section{Searching Mazes}
\label{\detokenize{chap12/chap12:searching-mazes}}
You can write your own maze search code that interacts with a front\sphinxhyphen{}end that is provided here. You can \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} the front\sphinxhyphen{}end code by clicking here. The front\sphinxhyphen{}end code requires the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tile20.gif}} file. It also requires at least one maze file. The file maze3.txt was used in the text to demonstrate the various search algorithms. Here are three maze files for downloading.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{maze.txt}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{maze2.txt}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{maze3.txt}}

\end{itemize}

Of course, you can write your own maze file as well. The format requires the number of rows on the first line, followed by the number of columns on the second line. Then the rest of the maze on the following lines must have an opening at the top for the entrance and an opening at the bottom for the exit.

The program is written as a front\sphinxhyphen{}end. Your challenge is to provide a back\sphinxhyphen{}end that supports the given search types. The architecture for your back\sphinxhyphen{}end is described at the top of the front\sphinxhyphen{}end code. The front\sphinxhyphen{}end is written to support five types of search, depth\sphinxhyphen{}first, bread\sphinxhyphen{}first, hill climbing, best\sphinxhyphen{}first, and a\sphinxhyphen{}star. If you wish to see a demonstration of these search types without writing your own back\sphinxhyphen{}end code first, you can \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} the search.fas file which is a compiled CLISP back\sphinxhyphen{}end. You must have CLISP installed on your system to run this back\sphinxhyphen{}end code.

Here is the front\sphinxhyphen{}end code for your reference.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\},numbers=left,firstnumber=1,stepnumber=1]
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{turtle}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{subprocess}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{tkinter}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{sys}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{time}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} The following program will animate a search algorithm written in a language of}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} your choice. The only requirement is that the programming language is able to }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} write to standard output and read from standard input following the architecture}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} outlined below. The program that you write is the back\PYGZhy{}end communicating to this}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} front\PYGZhy{}end code. A compiled lisp program serves as a back\PYGZhy{}end for demonstration}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} purposes and can be downloaded from the text website. This front\PYGZhy{}end}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} program and the back\PYGZhy{}end program communicate through pipes (both input and output)}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} according to this architecture. When a command is sent to the back\PYGZhy{}end it is indicated }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} with a right arrow indicating something is written to the back\PYGZhy{}end program\PYGZsq{}s }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} standard input. When the back\PYGZhy{}end program sends something to this front\PYGZhy{}end}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} it is indicated with a left arrow. That means it is written to the standard}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} output of the back\PYGZhy{}end program. }

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} front\PYGZhy{}end    back\PYGZhy{}end}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}   dfs \PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZgt{}     \PYGZsh{} A search type is selected, the back\PYGZhy{}end program must read}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}   maze.txt \PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZgt{}     \PYGZsh{} The filename is passed to the back\PYGZhy{}end program}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}   \PYGZlt{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} 0 10  \PYGZsh{} these are the row column pairs of visited locations}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}   ...                \PYGZsh{} repeating until the search is complete}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}   \PYGZlt{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} done  \PYGZsh{} Then done is printed by the back\PYGZhy{}end}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}   \PYGZlt{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} 31 22 \PYGZsh{} Finally the path is printed in reverse order}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}   ...                \PYGZsh{} All locations are printed}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}   \PYGZlt{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} eof   \PYGZsh{} EOF is printed back to be sent back to this application.}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} If you wish to implement your own back\PYGZhy{}end you must alter the line of code below}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} that looks like this:}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} proc = subprocess.Popen([\PYGZdq{}clisp\PYGZdq{},\PYGZdq{}search.fas\PYGZdq{}],stdout=subprocess.PIPE, \PYGZbs{}}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}    stdin=subprocess.PIPE,universal\PYGZus{}newlines=True)}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} You must replace clisp with the program that starts your program running. If you}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} have written your back\PYGZhy{}end with python 3.x then replace clisp with python3. }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} The search.fas should be replaced by any command\PYGZhy{}line arguments to your program. If }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} you have written your program in python, then the argument should be the name of your}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} program which must be in the same directory as this front\PYGZhy{}end code and the mazes you}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} with to search. }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Output that you want to print for debugging purposes can be written to standard error}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} instead of standard output. In this way standard output can be used to communicate}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} with the front\PYGZhy{}end while you still see output printed to the terminal window for }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} debugging purposes. In python, standard error can be written to as follows:}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} import sys}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} sys.stderr.write(\PYGZsq{}Your text goes here.\PYGZbs{}n\PYGZsq{})}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} This architecture must be adhered to strictly for this program to work. The search }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} types supported by the front\PYGZhy{}end code are: dfs, bfs, hill, best, astar. Here}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} is sample Lisp code that will handle this interaction from the front\PYGZhy{}end code. }

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(defun processCommand ()}
  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(let ((searchTtype \PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}) }
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(filename \PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{})}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(path nil))}


    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(setf searchType (read\PYGZhy{}line))}
    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(format *error\PYGZhy{}output* \PYGZdq{}Lisp says \PYGZhy{} Search Type is \PYGZti{}S\PYGZti{}\PYGZpc{}\PYGZdq{}  searchType)}
    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(setf filename (read\PYGZhy{}line))}


    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(cond ((equal searchType \PYGZdq{}dfs\PYGZdq{}) (setf path (dfsMaze filename)))}
          \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}((equal searchType \PYGZdq{}bfs\PYGZdq{}) (setf path (bfsMaze filename))))}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(format t \PYGZdq{}done\PYGZti{}\PYGZpc{}\PYGZdq{})}
    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(printPath path)}
    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(format t \PYGZdq{}eof\PYGZti{}\PYGZpc{}\PYGZdq{})))}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(processCommand)}

                    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} process line of final path node}
                    \PYG{n}{lst} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{line}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{split}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
                    \PYG{n}{row} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{int}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{lst}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}
                    \PYG{n}{col} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{int}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{lst}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}
                    \PYG{n}{length} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{int}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{lst}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}
                    \PYG{n}{t}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{goto}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{col}\PYG{o}{*}\PYG{l+m+mi}{20}\PYG{o}{+}\PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{row}\PYG{o}{*}\PYG{l+m+mi}{20}\PYG{o}{+}\PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{o}{+}\PYG{l+m+mi}{5}\PYG{p}{)}
                    \PYG{n}{t}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{write}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{length}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{align}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{center}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{font}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Arial}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{bold}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
                    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}t.dot(10)                    }
                    
                    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} read the next line}
                    \PYG{n}{line} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{fromLisp}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{readline}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{strip}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}                    

                \PYG{n}{proc}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{kill}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
                \PYG{n}{t}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{ht}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
                \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{running} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{False}

                
            \PYG{k}{except} \PYG{n+ne}{Exception} \PYG{k}{as} \PYG{n}{ex}\PYG{p}{:}
                \PYG{n}{tkinter}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{messagebox}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{showwarning}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Alert}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n+nb}{str}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{ex}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
                \PYG{n}{tb} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{sys}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{exc\PYGZus{}info}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{]}
                \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{running} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{False}
                \PYG{k}{raise} \PYG{n}{ex}

\section{N\sphinxhyphen{}Queens Problem}
\label{\detokenize{chap12/chap12:n-queens-problem}}
The N\sphinxhyphen{}Queens problem from the text can be solved using a depth first search with forward checking. A front\sphinxhyphen{}end program is provided so you can visualize the search for a solution. You can \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} the front\sphinxhyphen{}end code here.

The program is written as a front\sphinxhyphen{}end. Your challenge is to write the back\sphinxhyphen{}end code for this program. The architecture for your back\sphinxhyphen{}end is described at the top of the front\sphinxhyphen{}end code.
If you wish to visualize how this program works without writing your own back\sphinxhyphen{}end, you can \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{download}} the qsearch.fas file here. This file requires CLISP be installed to run. The qsearch.fas file must be placed in the same directory as the front\sphinxhyphen{}end queensanimate.py program to run.

Here is the front\sphinxhyphen{}end code for your reference.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\},numbers=left,firstnumber=1,stepnumber=1]
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{turtle}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{subprocess}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{tkinter}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{sys}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{time}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} The following program will animate the n\PYGZhy{}queens algorithm. This front\PYGZhy{}end}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} program and a back\PYGZhy{}end program communicate through pipes (both input and output)}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} according to this architecture. When a command is sent to the back\PYGZhy{}end it is indicated }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} with a right arrow indicating something is written to the back\PYGZhy{}end program\PYGZsq{}s }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} standard input. When the back\PYGZhy{}end program sends something to this front\PYGZhy{}end program}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} it is indicated with a left arrow. That means it is written to the standard}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} output of the back\PYGZhy{}end program. }

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Each state in the search consists of the currently placed queens (up to the current }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} row) and the remaining available locations above the row the last queen was placed in.}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} The architecture below repeats this state information over and over until the search}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} has found a solution. }

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} front\PYGZhy{}end   back\PYGZhy{}end}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}   8 \PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZgt{}       \PYGZsh{} A size is specified to the back\PYGZhy{}end program}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}   \PYGZlt{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} 0 10  \PYGZsh{} these are the row column pairs of possibly assigned queen locations}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}   ...                \PYGZsh{} repeating until the search is complete}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}   \PYGZlt{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} and   \PYGZsh{} The and is printed between the assigned and remaining locations}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}   \PYGZlt{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} 1 2   \PYGZsh{} next comes the remaining locations}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}   ...                \PYGZsh{} repeating until done}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}   \PYGZlt{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} done  \PYGZsh{} Then done is printed after each state is completely enumerated}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}   ...                \PYGZsh{} These states repeat until the search has concluded. }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}   \PYGZlt{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{} eof   \PYGZsh{} EOF is printed back to inidicate the end of the animation.}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} If you wish to implement your own backend you must alter the line of code below}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} that looks like this:}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} proc = subprocess.Popen([\PYGZdq{}clisp\PYGZdq{},\PYGZdq{}qsearch.fas\PYGZdq{}],stdout=subprocess.PIPE, \PYGZbs{}}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}    stdin=subprocess.PIPE,universal\PYGZus{}newlines=True)}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} You must replace clisp with the program that starts your program running. If you}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} have written your back\PYGZhy{}end with python 3.x then replace clisp with python3. }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} The qsearch.fas should be replaced by any command\PYGZhy{}line arguments to your program. If }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} you have written your program in python, then the argument should be the name of your}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} program which must be in the same directory as this front\PYGZhy{}end code. }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Output that you want to print for debugging purposes can be written to standard error}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} instead of standard output. In this way standard output can be used to communicate}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} with the front\PYGZhy{}end while you still see output printed to the terminal window for }
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} debugging purposes. In python, standard error can be written to as follows:}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} import sys}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} sys.stderr.write(\PYGZsq{}Your text goes here.\PYGZbs{}n\PYGZsq{})}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} This architecture must be adhered to strictly for this program to work. Here}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} is sample Lisp code that will handle this interaction.}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(defun queens\PYGZhy{}search (size)}
   \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(print\PYGZhy{}state (dfs (initialize size) \PYGZsh{}\PYGZsq{}(lambda (state) (eq (list\PYGZhy{}length }
   \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}                (first state)) size))))}
   \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(format t \PYGZdq{}eof\PYGZti{}\PYGZpc{}\PYGZdq{}))}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(defun processCommand ()}
  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(let ((size 8))}


    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(setf size (parse\PYGZhy{}integer (read\PYGZhy{}line)))}
    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(format *error\PYGZhy{}output* \PYGZdq{}Lisp says \PYGZhy{} Size is \PYGZti{}D\PYGZti{}\PYGZpc{}\PYGZdq{}  size)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(queens\PYGZhy{}search size)))}


\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{}(processCommand)}

                \PYG{k}{raise} \PYG{n}{ex}
                
            
                
        \PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{stop}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
            \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{running} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{False}

        \PYG{n}{fileMenu}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{add\PYGZus{}command}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{label}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Exit}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{command}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{master}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{quit}\PYG{p}{)}

        \PYG{n}{bar}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{add\PYGZus{}cascade}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{label}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{File}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{menu}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{fileMenu}\PYG{p}{)}

        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{master}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{config}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{menu}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{bar}\PYG{p}{)}

        \PYG{n}{canvas} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{tkinter}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Canvas}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{width}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{800}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{height}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{800}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n}{canvas}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{pack}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{side}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{tkinter}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{LEFT}\PYG{p}{)}

        \PYG{n}{theTurtle} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{turtle}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{RawTurtle}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{canvas}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n}{theTurtle}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{ht}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}         

        \PYG{n}{sideBar} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{tkinter}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Frame}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{padx}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{5}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{pady}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{5}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{relief}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{tkinter}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{RAISED}\PYG{p}{,} \PYGZbs{}
            \PYG{n}{borderwidth}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{5pt}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n}{sideBar}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{pack}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{side}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{tkinter}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{RIGHT}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{fill}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{tkinter}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{BOTH}\PYG{p}{)}
        
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{sizevar} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{tkinter}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{StringVar}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{sizevar}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{set}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{8}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
        
        \PYG{n}{selectLabel} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{tkinter}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Label}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{sideBar}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{text}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Problem Size}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n}{selectLabel}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{pack}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
        
        \PYG{n}{sizeEntryBox} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{tkinter}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Entry}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{sideBar}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{textvariable}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{sizevar}\PYG{p}{)}
        \PYG{n}{sizeEntryBox}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{pack}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
        
        \PYG{n}{sb} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{tkinter}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Button}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{sideBar}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{text}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Start}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{command}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{run}\PYG{p}{)}

        \PYG{n}{kb}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{pack}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{n}{main}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
